text: Ah the very first sonic game designs? third year is definietly more stressful with the whole quarantine situation haha, though there are perks for sure! trying to keep a good sleeping pattern is tough however... The guy I spoke to was simon green? MPC london I believe, only spoke over instagram briefly but it was a cool insite.

So would the shape artist also be responsible for the topology flow, since it often needs to be quite meticulous?  damn I imagine it's fun and rare to see a project/character go through those changes. if you don't mind me asking, did you find yourself working more in zbrush for modelling or maya? Given it's a stylised character.

I've been working on some creature blendshapes currently and i couldn't agree more, going in i imagined it to be super simple and quick to bash shapes out, but I found that any issues to do with form or a lack of insight into facial anatomy for the creature has made skin compressions/shapes much more difficult to execute effectively.
Ah cheers man! I am still worried about job prospects given the competitiveness of the modelling pipeline and also the whole corona situation
